website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice if you want to spend a bit less than other models but still want the performance of a KitchenAid. Otherwise, we recommend the Artisan Tilt-Head if value is your top concern.
pros: Offers KitchenAid's iconic stand mixer for an unbeatable price compared to other models
Runs with 275 watts of power, has a tilt head, and comes with the same attachments as the Pro Line – flat beater, wire whip, and dough hook
cons: The warranty is only 1 year, and the bowl has only a 4.5-quart capacity – but these are small concerns if you want a top-quality mixer at a value price

customer_reviews.title: used
customer_reviews.text: I received a used mixer, the power cable and base was dirty with black smudges
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete Instructions
customer_reviews.text: The reason my Kitchenaid did not get Five stars is not because it didn't do a good job, but because of incomplete instructions. On my first usage so far, after washing the bowl and beaters. I proceeded to mix homemade yeast bread. Upon removing dough from bowl there was some gray streaks in the dough. At their web site after trouble shooting it stated that a polishing material is used on stainless steel and prevents no danger but to rub this material wash bowl with salt and lemon or scrub with baking soda. It would really have been nice if that had been stated in the instruction booklet.
customer_reviews.author: A. G. Gant

customer_reviews.title: No Good
customer_reviews.text: Joined Amazon Prime to get this mixer for the weekend, big party. Plugged it in and just hum's. Gears are jammed and will not turn. That's Quality Control for ya.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Broken part
customer_reviews.text: Just got my KitchenAid Stand Mixer in today and its a beauty. I checked all the pieces but one of the parts is damaged. I did turn it on and checked the settings. So it seems to be working other then the damaged part. They replaced the broken part.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Defective from day 1
customer_reviews.text: Does not work straight out of the box. Just buzzes and gets warm. Terrible experience, and now I have a ton of wasted ingredients I had prepared for baking. I expect a full replacement or refund. Be wary when buying one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy B. Whicker

customer_reviews.title: I bought a Kitchenaid last year November 2017 I have ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Kitchenaid last year November 2017 I have used it only 3 times. Yesterday, 13 February 2018 I switched it on and it made a big spark! Now it doesn't want to work. I am in South Africa and apparently it is not under warranty if you don't live in USA! What can I do? Where do I send it for repairs? Is my Kitchenaid still under warranty and can I take it to our Kitchenaid store in Cape Town South Africa ?
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: FAULTY
customer_reviews.text: When I turn it onto "stir" it pulses very fast and there are sparks inside. I checked youtube videos and all the others spin slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Pietro Baroni

customer_reviews.title: Hard lesson learned
customer_reviews.text: Yes, It's a KitchenAid mixer but beware - this is the baby of the family. It's considerably smaller, less powerful and has a much smaller bowl than expected and the bowl is flimsy compared to the full sized model. I purchased this as a gift and was horribly embarrassed that it was so puny. Would be OK for a child's first, but woefully inadequate for a cooks kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Su Bee

customer_reviews.title: LOVE This Item
customer_reviews.text: I've had this more than a year now and it still works great. Double and triple batches of cookies, masa for tamales, and bread dough are now easy. I LOVE it. I think everyone needs one of these if they are serious about cooking. When I bought it I also bought the paddle with a scraper side--saves time. I wished I'd bought the shield too. I plan to soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline C. Bartha

customer_reviews.title: Never use a hand mixer again
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought one 10 years ago!!! I will never use my hand mixer again, easier clean up and faster. making dough by hand can take 20-30 minutes, i make six batches in that time now!!
customer_reviews.author: Droned2

customer_reviews.title: Get one now!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, first let me start by saying i researched like crazy on which one to get my wife... turns out the classic was gonna be sufficient and i was correct. She loves it... i knew she been wanting one forever and every time we would have 300 dollars to spend on one something always came up, such is life. Well i saved up to get her one and she couldnt be happier my waist line though... its been happier haha.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Dodge

customer_reviews.title: weak POS
customer_reviews.text: Kitchen Aid is supposed to be a great product, Not so. I keep trying to kneed bread dough and it is not possible. as long as the dough is thin an watery it works fine. As soon as i ad more flour to make it thicker the mixer bogs down, overheats and stops working. The head wobbles as if it's about to break of. It is grossly under powered and cheaply made.I do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Michal Strenk

customer_reviews.title: I don't think these are new units, mine arrived dented
customer_reviews.text: As pictured, the metal rim has several dents in it.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Altman

customer_reviews.title: A tool your grandchild will be able to use...
customer_reviews.text: I waited for years to buy one have been baking for a week. The price is excellent look in a store try to find one for this price. KitchenAid is a mixer that will last a lifetime. I have a friend who has her grandma's and bought a new one because of her cooking ministry the new one 10 years later works as well as the grandma's. I am the only one in my group that does not have one but 400.00 dollars with all these bells and whistles is not what I needed or special colors. Buy basic colors and you will never regret because neon will look odd in your kitchen in 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel De' foe

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid quality has decreased
customer_reviews.text: It came without the spring on the shaft that holds the beaters. This was a gift for my daughter after her last KitchenAid dies after 6 years. Fortunately her husband was able to remove the spring from the old mixer and put it on the new mixer so he didn't think it needed to be returned. I have had a KitchenAid mixer for 45 years with no problems. Obviously the quality control by KitchenAid is poor now.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: just what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Kitchen Aid mixer for more than 30 I have had a KitchenAid mixer for more tha 30 plus years.My Dad gave it to me as a gift. I love itand use it sooften...Wanted togive the same LONG LASTING gift of love and quality to our son...So when he makes cookiesmin ten years with his kitchen aid he will think of me... A GREAT PRODUCT...... =
customer_reviews.author: Sissy Louise

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves this, but it failed less than 2 years later
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves this, as she’s been wanting one for a while. It works well and has helped with food prep since Christmas. I bought it for my wife as a gift and she uses it every now and then. After very limited use there was a blue flash and this thing trips the breaker and no longer works. Its had less then 2 years of use and barely gets used. Either buy the warranty or steer clear. Amazon should stand by this product and allow a return. I'll be using Costco for the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Tyson

customer_reviews.title: When a 10 year old ask for a Kitchen Aid stand alone mixer for Christmas!
customer_reviews.text: I asked my 10 year old grand daughter what she wanted for Christmas. Out popped, Nana, I want a Kitchen Aid stand alone mixer! I started her baking when she was old enough to stand in a chair at the counter. She loves to bake cookies, cupcakes, and even make a Christmas cake last week from scratch! I hope she is excited as I am on Christmas Day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient to stir batter.
customer_reviews.text: After using the largest Kitchen Aid Mixer for over 40 yrs. (never any problems) I bought this smaller model for its lighter weight and height. The older model didn’t fit under my older, lower, cupboards and I had to carry it back and forth. I have found that this one, with a very different bowl shape needs much stirring. This means raising the top and fighting to get around the beater. Frustrating and time consuming. Wish I had known this before purchasing. My older one also handles a double batch MUCH better. It’s coming back out again.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: but I am very satisfied with the classic version - it handles bread
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a replacement for a larger kitchen aid Pro mixer which finally bit the dust. The modified designs for the Pro versions no longer fit into my designated cabinet space and I was a bit skeptical about the classic series. Because the bowl size is smaller it doesn't make the larger batches I used to make with the Pro version, but I am very satisfied with the classic version - it handles bread, cakes, cookies and egg whites with the excellent outcomes expected from a KitchenAid.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Leivermann

customer_reviews.title: They have not changed a thing ( don't fix what's not broken) in all these years which gives me confidence the design is a good o
customer_reviews.text: I dropped my 25 year old Classic which is the only reason I had to purchase another.The old one worked as well as the day I bought it untill I "killed it"! Point being these are high quality proven machines. They have not changed a thing ( don't fix what's not broken) in all these years which gives me confidence the design is a good one PLUS I don't have to rebuy all the attachments, they all still fit!!
customer_reviews.author: John Spears

customer_reviews.title: A new lease on cooking.
customer_reviews.text: I always thought that mixers were for the Donna Reeds’ of the world, women who had nothing to do but cook and clean. Or chefs. I am neither but since I am retired I thought I would try it. I love it! It makes whipping up a quick recipe so easy. I even got into bread making, something I was always bad at. I have made so many dishes with it and I never feel chained to the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I have used mine for dough, cake batter, and grinding venison. The dough hook and the beater work great. I bought a grinder attachment for processing ground venison (my old grinder died). While I can't drop 20 pounds of venison into it at a time, it still gets the job done. Grinding can put serious stress on the motor and I have ground maybe 50 pounds this year without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife as a gift and she was thrilled!! KitchenAid is the stand alone when it comes to mixers and this hasn’t disappointed at all. Very versatile, as there are many attachments that are available for use, and durable as well. This gets a great deal of use in our kitchen and will continue to as these are built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: Amateur feels like a pro now
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a Kitchenaid mixer for so long. I am a new home baker and feel like a stronger one with it. I got a great deal on this before the holidays. (I would have loved a bigger color selection on this deal but I was okay with what I got since it was such a good discount. It has been so much fun to use. Though I would recommend getting it and using it a while before deciding on which attachments you get. I bought a couple and after a year plus I still haven't used them. I mostly make cakes/cookies
customer_reviews.author: Amy E Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Love all the attachments! Many uses!
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! It was at such a great price too! I can use it to make my cookie recipes, or just in general mixing things up that are harder for people like me to do. When I say people like me, I mean because I have carpal tunnel, and arthritis in my hands. Having something take the repetitive mixing out of the occasion for me is great! My husband even likes it because we bought a grinder attachment and used it to grind his Venison meat to make sausage. If you ever wanted a stand mixer, I would always chose a Kitchen-aid over any other, because they seem to be sturdier and last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Nat.M.

customer_reviews.title: Yup, it's a KitchenAid
customer_reviews.text: What else needs to be said? This mixer works very well. It is my first mixer, as I typically mix things by hand. However, I was asked to make one of my best friends' wedding cake, and knew that it was a task for an actual mixer. For a tall 2 layer cake, I did have to do two batches since the bowl isn't big enough for that much cake batter. Even at full capacity, it handled excellently!
customer_reviews.author: Hanna Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Did not completely replace my hand held mixer
customer_reviews.text: Waited years to buy a standup mixer like this...always had a smaller hand held one. That being said, I needed to adjust for a few things: it is heavy to carry and put away after use, tools dont reach the very bottom of the bowl so you need to shut off and scrape it to keep mixing. The hook works well, I've made a few batches of bread dough. Overall I am satisfied but I still have my hand held and use it since it's much easier to operate. Paint came chipped in inconspicuous spots.
customer_reviews.author: D R

customer_reviews.title: must have for kitchen warriors
customer_reviews.text: 18 years cooking exp and this is a must for those looking to take your baking to another level as well as making meals at home the proper way. 4.5 QT is perfect size to store in smaller kitchens or leave out without taking up too much free counter space.
customer_reviews.author: thom805

customer_reviews.title: KITCHENAID TOOK A REAL STEP BACKWARD WITH THIS ONE
customer_reviews.text: I really miss the handle, which shows in product picture on the manufacturer's delivery box. Beater jumps around and does not contact all batter in the bowl. I wanted the new black color, but discarded this one and went back to my old tried and true Kitchenaid mixer.
customer_reviews.author: CPSDohio

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this one. I mean, it says "Classic" right in the title!
customer_reviews.text: Have used a KitchenAid mixer for years and now needed one of my own. I have used this several times now and is one of my favorite tools in my kitchen. It's sturdy, only a little noisy, and easily whips up anything you throw at it. I'm looking forward to getting a few attachments in time. You can't go wrong with this guy.
customer_reviews.author: ScholDaddy

customer_reviews.title: it looks like a used one and the bowl is dirty
customer_reviews.text: it looks like a used one and the bowl is dirty ,very disappointed it
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: An Absolute Must
customer_reviews.text: In spite of the weight of the mixer, it is a fabulous piece of kitchen equipment that I cannot believe I did without. My cooking/baking over the holidays was made a thousand times easier because of it and when you doing it all on your own it's invaluable.
customer_reviews.author: PJ Cain

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, purchase local
customer_reviews.text: The thing doesn’t turn off or stay off. Save your $$ and purchase this in a local store with a return policy. I received it as a gift from my wife. Stuck with it-
customer_reviews.author: JST

customer_reviews.title: Almost 11 years
customer_reviews.text: I got this Kitchenaid mixer almost 11 years old, and for the first time it started to make some weird noises. Looks like I will be buying a new one soon. But for sure will be the same brand and if I find a similar model, I will buy it. Will recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sada

customer_reviews.title: This mixer works great!...until the warranty is up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mixer back in 2017 and although I do not bake as often as I'd like, the mixer bowl recently started popping out of the holder and now doesn't stay when I am mixing dough (unless I'm physically holding the bowl down). The only way it will stay in is if its on a low speed (on the first or second notch) and with a very small amount of contents in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I particularly bought this model because I have one like it that is missing apart and the better is chipped. This ne one does not have a handle in the bowl like the old one, however the picture on the information does show one. This makes it difficult to pour batter into a pan. Also the beater(paddle) does not reach lower part of the bowl and requires manual mixing. If I could lift it I would like to send it back Any helpful suggestions would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Edith Wade

customer_reviews.title: Finally! Best kitchen accessory!
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine! I am so excited to finally own one. I love to cook and to bake, and the selling point for me with the KitchenAid Stand Mixer is the versatility of uses, and all of the additional attachments that can make cooking and baking easier. So far I’ve made successful meringues, pasta, shortbread cookies, and focaccia bread. Thanks KitchenAid! I have a lot of hope that this will be a durable staple in my kitchen for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wondered how this model would handle bread doughs and delicate cookie doughs and both turned out just perfect. Glad I have a permanent spot for this ...
customer_reviews.text: No surprises here. It's a Kitchen Aid and performs as such. I wondered how this model would handle bread doughs and delicate cookie doughs and both turned out just perfect. Glad I have a permanent spot for this mixer as it is heavy but it remains very stable during use.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: The wife cooks more, and better. ;)
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I can get my wife not to use this. If you're a man and hunt, get this and get the full metal meat grinder. Its $160 but a great addition. You'll get just as much use making sausages and ground meat for burgers as she will making pastas. Best part you can put the meat in the pasta! Eat hardy, do yourself a favor get one.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I finally got a KitchenAid Classic. I grew up with my Mum using hers almost every day. It was such a great thing to take it out of the box and have memories of my childhood come flooding back. My Mum had hers for over 30 years...it finally died on her and I am sure could have been fixed but she didn't want to deal with it. I am teaching my daugter to bake and cook and this has been such a great addition to the kitchen. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Hordeprincess

customer_reviews.title: Kitchenaid mixers are built to last
customer_reviews.text: It’s a kitchenaid mixer. You’ve wanted one for a while. This one is near the bottom of their lineup, but the mixer itself still seems to be quality. You’ll only have to buy it once. The bowl doesn’t have a handle, so you may have to buy one with a handle if that annoys you.
customer_reviews.author: Elan Weinberg

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Thought is was a little clunky when mixing dough but my husband said that's probably just how it is for dough. Probably need higher powdered Model if you want a smoother mix. It's fine though. I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: bobbi

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer
customer_reviews.text: I admittedly bought this because I wanted to be in the "in crowd." I've always used handheld mixers, and I didn't think anything of this stand mixer. My low expectations did me well since I'm completely in love with it! Great for preparing cakes, cookies, bread, you name it. The kit came with coated flat beater, coated dough hook, wire whip. The only thing is - I wished I have the flex edge beater because it can be a pain scraping the batter from the sides and bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye A

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid what more can you say
customer_reviews.text: I've been cheap all my life and bought inexpensive mixers both stand and hand. I should have bought this first then I wouldn't have wasted my money on all the others. Buy it it will last a lifetime. Then will it to your grand kids when you die.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W

customer_reviews.title: This is a quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer along with a meat grinder attachment. I used it to make ground turkey , bread dough , cake batters and cookie dough. It has worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: andrew yankovich

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this mixer :))))
customer_reviews.text: I never knew a mixer could make such a difference. I absolutely love it and wish I had bought one years before. Be sure to purchase the bowl with a handle. KitchenAid should provide the bowl with a handle for all their mixers but doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure she would love hers
customer_reviews.text: This product was a gift I have the same one for 6years now and I love it
customer_reviews.author: julia

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Never had a stand before I really enjoy having the this mixer it makes bread wonderfully I’m happy the way you can take it apart and clean it quickly. I even found some cookbooks for stand mixers.
customer_reviews.author: Maynard Burt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister in law and she just loves it! She is baking more now!
customer_reviews.author: christina sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is awesome! It’s super easy to use, sturdy, and easy to clean! All the parts and components that we have can be interchanged quickly and easily. I haven’t had it very long but seems to be high quality and will probably last me a long time :)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica DeSotle

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: The kitchen Aid mixer didn't hold up well under normal household use. I only had it a little under 2 years and the head started wobbling even when locked in place. This is my second one, and the quality has gotten cheaper. Won't by an other one. Repair guy wanted $75 just to look at it and see if it needed a part, not including the labor to repair it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my mother as a holiday gift
customer_reviews.text: My parents use it to make cakes and other desserts. They don't use it often but they do use it when they want to make a dessert. It is very heavy so just be aware when you buy!
customer_reviews.author: sweetserenity

customer_reviews.title: The last mixer I'll own!!!
customer_reviews.text: My first KitchenAid mixer lasted 38 years, though raising 3 kids and countless meals. The most solid consumer grade mixer you can own. My the kids can fight over my KitchenAid when I'm gone!
customer_reviews.author: Mctx

customer_reviews.title: A Workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: I have been struggling with a handheld mixer for 30 years. This Kitchenaid is a dream come true for kneading bread dough and whipping cream. Wish I had bought it years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Mother’s Day for my Mom and she absolutely LOVED it!!! She was so excited and I was excited for her bring that she bakes allot this definitely will come in handy and useful for her. Arrived fast too!! And packaged very well
customer_reviews.author: S_jashirele

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid mixer always good try to buy new
customer_reviews.text: KitchenAid mixers are always great. I bought this one and should read in a little bit further that it was refurbished always try to buy a new had a problem and had to buy a new gear for the mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Romeel Lal

customer_reviews.title: I Love my mixer because its performs well and speed up ...
customer_reviews.text: I Love my mixer because its performs well and speed up my time in the kitchen. The least thing that dislike it is the speed control is located on the other side from my position so I don't see easily my speed selection. It is like backwards to me. But overall I really enjoy my mixer
customer_reviews.author: Maflal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product - Size might be an issue.
customer_reviews.text: It's a KitchenAid, so it's an excellent tool. However, I think I might have gone with the larger size. 4.5 qrts is good for small batch items, but its at its capacity when making bread or larger items.
customer_reviews.author: John Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife. She absolutely loves it and uses it often. Easy to use. Easy to clean. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thousands of uses
customer_reviews.text: Wife wanted this unit because she had multiple tool attachments already and now I have gained a few extra pounds from the desserts etc she is making.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt Mac

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Not the latest but it gets the job done. I've pushed it to the limits for Thanksgiving and Christmas with cakes, cupcakes and it didn't stop working. I worked it like I was running a little bakery
customer_reviews.author: Mantis

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it online go to the store
customer_reviews.text: The product was delivered damaged The packet seemed to have been hit by something and it broke one of the attachment
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: A perfect match for my larger 6 qt mixer. Not as strong a motor as i hoped for making thick batter. Be careful not to over heat motor.
customer_reviews.author: burnt thumbs

customer_reviews.title: Great decision
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad that I got the product to use with the Kitchen Aid mixer. It was the best decision I ever made to do this. I am so happy.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Brown

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift. They loved it, and have been baking nonstop. Google how to clean it before you use it for the first time as there is a coating in the bowl you need to remove before first use.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon T.

customer_reviews.title: disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: About 3 months of using this the gears have started to make a grinding noise between switching speeds. Also when making chocolate chip cookie and top of the fixer wants to bounce up and down with the lock engaged. I was hoping for a good quality mixer and that is NOT what I received!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my kitchenaid
customer_reviews.text: Love my kitchenaid. The only thing is that it does start to over heat if I have a lot of thick bread dough.
customer_reviews.author: JessandAlec

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: This is the most important kitchen item to have besides your stove! Does so much with the separate purchase attachments.
customer_reviews.author: L. Farley

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 24 years!
customer_reviews.text: My KitchenAid Classic just turned 24 this year and it's been the most wonderful and useful appliance I've ever had! I've used to to make everything-bread to brownies and never had a problem with it. I bought the same machine for my sister a few years back and she loves it too! I don't bake bread every week so maybe that would be the only reason to look for one with the more powerful motor but for your typical household baker or even one who bakes more than average, the Classic should more than suffice.
customer_reviews.author: I. McClain

customer_reviews.title: I love it so much I am looking for projects
customer_reviews.text: How did I bake without it. I love it so much I am looking for projects. I just mastered macarons although it took multiple tries. Kitchen aid wins over any handhold device, plus I find my cakes being more consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: USED PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughters house warming gift! She opened the box to use and it had been USED! All paperwork had dried up food on it and the instruction manual does not even match up to the product we bought. There were missing parts and more!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Christmas gift, easy to use nut you can only use the size bowl that comes with it. I recommend the scraper mixer attachment and a shield as flour being added will come out at higher speed but on stir it is real slow and works well.
customer_reviews.author: CJ816

customer_reviews.title: HOW USEFUL IT HAS BEEN SAVING TIME
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS FOR MY GRANDDAUGHTER AND SHE LOVES IT, IN FACT SHE JUST CALLED ME TODAY AND SAID THANK YOU FOR THE MIXER IT JUST SHREDDED MY CHICKEN FOR MY SUPPER, SHE WAS SUPER EXCITED AND HAS USED IT JUST ABOUT EVERY DAY SINCE SHE GOT IT FROM MAKING BREAD, TO WAFFLES, TO SHREDDING CHICKEN, BEST PRESENT I COULD HAVE GIVEN HER..
customer_reviews.author: ginger meza

customer_reviews.title: but I hated making frosting until this bad boy came along
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a god send. I'm no fancy baker, but I hated making frosting until this bad boy came along. It changed my life. Just be careful dumping in flour and powdered sugar. I had quite the disaster making frosting last week (user error entirely). Just check before buying to see which versions come with rebates.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Cunnington

customer_reviews.title: My Wife loves hers, she is using it all the time
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this. It is industrial made, and my wife, already a great cook uses it all the time. Con: I'm getting fat since she uses every chance she gets.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best Mixer i ever had
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this one to replace the one I Bought over 40 years ago. I will repair the old one when i get a chance and possibly keep them Both
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ogborn

customer_reviews.title: Saves baking time!
customer_reviews.text: Waited too many years and landed on this one. Love it. Takes getting used to after decades of hand mixer use but helps so much to multitask while baking.
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: Fave Kitchen Applicance
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and already used it! It's no secret that this is a great product. It is now my favorite kitchen appliance. It makes me feel like I'm in a professional kitchen although I'm in a regular apartment sized kitchen :-) I wish I was able to get this version in red, but the black/silver works really well in my kitchen too! I recommend to anyone that enjoys baking. This will make everything much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Dover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Can never go wrong with Kitchen Aid this is my third Kitchen aid. It helps because I do so much baking.
customer_reviews.author: Jancy

customer_reviews.title: Love my mixer
customer_reviews.text: Love my mixer. I use it quite often to make dips, meatloaf and more. The top portion tilts up, which makes it easy to add ingredients or change the utinsel you need.
customer_reviews.author: dino alcini

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer a couple of years ago and the truth is that I enjoy it more every day. I do like to cook and especially make pizza dough. The confidence of buying a kitchenAid product has no comparison with other brands. I buy it in black and it also looks spectacular in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Present
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a present for my mom because she could not find the black locally. She loves the look and the mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Magill

customer_reviews.title: Oil, grease, dents and scratches!!!
customer_reviews.text: Received the package in very good time, however the mixer itself was a problem. My wife pulled it out of the box and got her hands covered in grease. It had been smeared all over the unit. There were a few scratches on the back and top of the unit and a nice big dent around the rim where it mixes. We figured to give it a go though and tried to mix our first batch of cookies. The mixture had black streaks in it and we found out that it was leaking oil into our cookies! What a hunk of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great appliance
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like about a Kitchen Aid mixer. I like that I don't have to stand with a hand held mixer anymore. I just turn on the Kitchen Aid and then continue with other preparations. Also, it is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen W.

customer_reviews.title: what more can you ask for
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for cookies, breads, meringue, pizza dough, cakes and frostings, and have had no issues. works great, runs great, what more can you ask for
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: GORGEOUS
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It's so sturdy and hefty and I cannot wait to make dozens of cakes and cookies. This beauty is going to get a workout, and I know this one will last. Excited to have a decent mixer etc. that has settings beyond fast and faster. *girly squeal*
customer_reviews.author: NiQ

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted a Kitchenaid Mixer and this was a gift from my husband. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: L**F

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Used to have this mixer when I was decorating cakes. But that was a long time ago. Bought it because I have started baking again and love how my brownes and cakes get great compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Brown

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Perfect size for a large family!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I dislike about this. I always wanted a bigger one but this one is large enough! I purchased all attachments and love them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mixer for the price.  nice size
customer_reviews.text: I love the product, but the delivery driver delivered it to the wrong condo. they had to find me and I had to carry the very heavy box. they did not even try to get to the right place. just dropped it at the first place not even close to the right number of condo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I've always used a handheld mixer for baking and this has changed my life. I wish I bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: Come holiday time, I would be lost without this! Year after year I used to help my mother make cookies for the holiday season. Now as an adult I find myself returning to those traditions. This mixer makes a breeze of the holiday recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Kepes

customer_reviews.title: wife loved it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife, she was surprised, and began using it, giving her other stand mixer to her daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for uor needs.
customer_reviews.text: Worked out very well. Lots of cooking in our home with 5 kids. It's perfect for us. It does all the baked goods and heavy enough to mix meat loaf easily.
customer_reviews.author: Todd W.

customer_reviews.title: Best XMAS gift ever... so says my girlfriend!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for her for Xmas and she loves it and I love all the awesome things we now bake and make!!!
customer_reviews.author: brian keith schnaare

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am so thrilled with this mixer! I had saved up Amazon gift cards until I could purchase it and use it all the time. It was worth the wait.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's as good as the expensive ones
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned that it may be underpowered since it's "only" 250 watts. So far, even the heaviest batter doesn't slow it down. My wife hasn't used any attachments, so there may be an issue there, but for mixing, it's as good as the expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: JRTJH

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean up a breeze!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter. She has been wanting one for a while now! It’s her, my son in law and 5 children! She loves to cook and so do the children! She gets a lot of use out of this and is making home made bread, pizza dough and the best mash potatoes! She is so happy to have this in her kitchen! She is using recipes she didn’t have time for before!
customer_reviews.author: Irene Martin

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Aid is still a good mixer
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally shorted my mother-in-law's mixer when checking the brushes. Could have sworn I unplugged it....If I can fix the old one I'll have one for the summer house.
customer_reviews.author: Dilligaf

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KITCH K45SSOB Mixer 4.5, 250watts, Onyx Black
product_meta.description: Color:Onyx BlackThe KitchenAid Classic Series Tilt-Head Stand Mixer includes a 4.5-quart stainless steel mixing bowl and 10 speeds to easily mix, knead and whip your favorite ingredients. For even more versatility, the power hub is designed to use the motor's power to operate optional attachments from food grinders to pasta makers and more.
feature_bullets: Multipurpose attachment hub, over 15 Optional attachments
Includes coated flat beater, Coated dough hook, wire whip; 1-year

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars3,625 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
